ATTENTION!
If you are having problems with the game crashing after you put this in your folder more then likely you have two monitors. it doesn't support two. You need to unplug a screen or disable it in your settings.

I downloaded this from http://www.newvegasnexus.com/ and so far I've see a serious improvement in the games performance. No more NPC lag, but I did have one strange issue. For some reason, my character suddenly started moving incredibly slow! Then I found how to start moving at normal speed again, but I had to hold down the shift key to do so. I exited game and haven't played since then. I'll keep you posted. But so far, I've gotta say dispited that small issue; the patch is a must.

Actually, scratch what I said earlier about having to hold shift. I forgot that you have to have caps lock on to run. I strongly recommend using this feature, unless you like moving through vast land at extremely slow speeds. Just a heads up. One thing I did notice thought is when you are in large outdoor environments, it will break up audio and have some graphic stutter for just a moment from time to time. Still beats playing it without the patch.
Massive improvement with my ATI 4870 512 MB after using this file. Many thanks.

File is D3D#.dll
Don't bother downloading.
Update DirectX and you'll have the correct file.
Downloading .dlls and dumping them in your system folders is not only potentially risky but completely unnecessary. [Link]http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?familyid=2DA43D38-DB71-4C1B-BC6A-9B6652CD92A3&displaylang=en[/Link]

specs:

4gb ddr2 memory
1gb nvidia gt240m

@jbm0109

"This .dll file is essentially a light-wrapper for a 'supported' video card's .dll, which tricks the game into configuring its FaceGen software (which was causing the problem) in a more efficient manner. "

Yesno, gaming on a netbook is rife with woes. I advise you buy something a little more suited for gaming.

This DLL has been around for a while and works wonders. Especially for New Vegas. New Vegas has issues with areas with a high number of NPC's, and this DLL fixes that. I'm running at 1920x1080 with 8xAA, 16xAF, with everything all the way up and it's rock solid at 60fps vsync no matter how heavy the action gets, which is what it should be. Not sure why Bethesda wouldn't fix this issue on their own.
Fallout.New.Vegas.Update.2-SKIDROW, FPS went up 20-30fps and stuttering around NPCs ceased after using this fix.
